item.description:
This is the travel date event post for Hudson Valley Hiker's weekend-long July 4 weekend to the beautiful Rangeley-Stratton region of Maine ... where we'll be hiking across long stretches of the Appalachian trail and its tributary routes ... reaching 10 4000-footer peaks as well as other smaller ones.


These hikes will begin in lush deep balsam forests ... rising through graying scrub and invariably to broad alpine summits, with glorious views and amazing multicolor groundcover strewn with weird boulders and other glacial remnants. As we hike to be able to meet the occasional AT through-hiker and hear their trail stories as they are reaching the northern end of the Appalachian trail and the end of their hiking quest.

 

LINKS TO EACH DAY'S PLANS:

  

JULY 2             JULY 3              JULY 4


Click here:  The Complete Google Maps Driving Plan

 

NOTES ABOUT THIS TRIP:

 

  • You can RSVP for the entire weekend here and / or RSVP individually for the following three days; if you've RSVP'd for one of the other days but not here, I will add your name here as going for the weekend.
  • CONTACT ME WITH YOUR QUESTIONS: jmmoran @ nycap.rr.com, Mobile 518-281-5882 ... PLEASE -- NO CALLS UNTIL THE DAY OF THE TRIP.  Please feel free to email me your thoughts about this trip ... you can send SMS messages to me as well.
  • Each of these three days involves a long hike, so be sure to study very carefully all the details contained in the following three days of calendar posts (as they are created / updated).  As of today (03-05-2011) all the event descriptions, maps, links and other descriptions should be finished.
  • All trip information and updates will be added each day's event plans. Please use this page's comment section below to work out transportation and lodging issues.
  • Please note -- all these hikes are dog-friendly (and Mike is coming) -- if you are an anti-dog person, don't come.
  • Initially we'll be traveling to The Maine Roadhouse and stay there Friday night (07-01-2011) and you may be able to stay there during the remander of this trip (if you're with a car / driver sharing your lodging interests!).  CLICK HERE for Google Map directions to The Maine Roadhouse.  Then after that there will be camping options as well ... currently the driving and camping plan is as follows :

 

  1. Friday Night:  Stay at The Main Roadhouse ("B" on the Google Maps Driving Plan).
  2. Saturday Morning / Night:  Drive to the Day One trailhead near Stratton, ME ("C" on the Google Maps Driving Plan); then, after the hike, drive to a camp at the Day Two CAR SPOT west of Kingfield, ME (near "D" on the Google Maps Driving Plan -- the actual spot is NOT identified on the map ... CLICK HERE for the directions page to this location).
  3. Sunday Morning / Night:  Drive to the Day Two hike start at the Saddleback Ski Area  ("E" on the Google Maps Driving Plan), then camp that night again at the Day Two CAR SPOT west of Kingfield, ME.
  4. Monday:  Drive to the Day Three hike start area ("F" on the Google Maps Driving Plan).  We can drive home afterward or, if you want to take an extra day (and you have a ride!), we can opt to camp there and stay one more day.


LOOK FORWARD TO SHARING THE TRAIL WITH YOU ALL!  

Julie + Mike.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the Green Honda Element ...
item.why: These are among the most beautiful mountains in the Northeast ...
item.name: TRIP INFO: WEEKEND IN THE LONGFELLOW MOUNTAINS [MAINE]
